attributes.action: Make it illegal for childcare providers to charge when they are closed.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to make it illegal for nurseries/childcare providers to charge people for a service they are not actually providing.
attributes.background: For example on bank holidays nurseries are closed, I myself like many others work bank holidays and I still have to pay the full cost of childcare for the day even though nurseries are closed by their own choice and I then have to make other arrangements for childcare on those day's.

rejection.details:
The pricing, and opening times, of privately provided childcare are matters for individual providers and parents, and not something for which either the UK Government or Parliament are responsible. 

You might like to sign these petition which call for related actions:

'Commission an independent review of childcare funding and affordability': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586700

'Provide free childcare to working parents for children over 9 months.': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580622

'Extend 15 hours free childcare to all 2-year old children': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593737
